ideogram
Class IdeogramBean

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  ideogram.IdeogramBean
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, java.util.Observer, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class IdeogramBean
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.io.Serializable, java.util.Observer, java.awt.event.ActionListener

Visual representation of a single ideogram. To show the ideogram a database has to be loaded or attached with IdeogramBean.LoadDatabase or IdeogramBean.setIdeogramDB

Author:
muellera
See Also:
Serialized Form

setWidth

public void setWidth(int minWidth,
                     int maxWidth)
Sets the width-range of the ideogram graphic. So if the size of the panel changes the graphic will not exceed the given boundary.

Parameters:
minWidth - Minimum width of the ideogram graphic.
maxWidth - Maximum width of the ideogram graphic.

Parameters:

YCoordToBase

public long YCoordToBase(int y)
Transforms a canvas y coordinate to basepairs.

Parameters:

Returns:
Basepair offset.

MarkerToXCoord

public int MarkerToXCoord(int count)
Compute the x-coordinate of a marker position. If count is > 0 the markers are placed on the right side of the ideogram. If count is < 0 the markers will be on the left side.

Parameters:
count - Maker value.
Returns:
x-coordinate

XCoordToMarker

public int XCoordToMarker(int x)
Converts a x-coordinate in this panel into a marker value.

Parameters:
x -
Returns:
Integer marker value between -n ... n.
